snippet: The fragile alliance over migrants in Europe showed signs of strain after Austria and Slovenia threatened to build border fences and Bavaria sought to stem the flow into Germany.

byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy and Alison Smale reported from Berlin, and Barbara Surk from Spielfeld, Austria. Austin Ramzy contributed reporting from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By MELISSA EDDY, BARBARA SURK and ALISON SMALE

abstract: Austria announces plans to build fence along border with Slovenia, provoking Slovenian officials to repeat threats of building their own fence; flare-up threatens to derail fragile European alliance amid surge of Middle Eastern migrants; Germany has also raised concerns, saying its southern state of Bavaria has become overwhelmed by asylum seekers.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The fragile alliance over migrants in Europe showed signs of strain after Austria and Slovenia threatened to build border fences and Bavaria sought to stem the flow into Germany.

headline.print_headline: Fragile Alliance Shows Signs of Fraying Over Migrants
headline.main: Austria and Slovenia Trade Threats as Tensions Over Migrants Grow
